urls.description: Your one stop website for up to date information about flooding, weather and traffic disruptions across the Borough of Calderdale.

tweets.text: An @EnvAgencyYNE flood alert is in force for the Upper River Calder catchment. This means that flooding is possible so please be ready to follow your flood plan if needed and check https://t.co/kfCZXvMinX, https://t.co/SOPqHGairw and @MetOfficeYorks for updates. https://t.co/wrKykeStmX
The torrential rain outside has triggered the @EnvAgencyNW flood alert microapp on my @Citrix Workspace. Just pages of the things. Lots of reports of flooding about. https://t.co/gzYGmZi8xX

tweets.text:
@EnvAgencyNW put flood alert in place for the lower River Ribble and River Darwen at Walton-le-Dale üåßÔ∏è
https://t.co/b2Wh37880T @prestoncouncil @southribblebc @PrestonPolice @SthRibblePolice #StormAiden

After this weekend‚Äôs rainfall ‚õà‚òîÔ∏è, stay updated overnight on the latest information on river levels in Yorkshire and the North East. Our information is updated every 15 minutes 
https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb

River levels are high across the area and the forecast is unsettled for the next 48 hours ‚Äì remain vigilant and check your #flood risk to #staysafe. 

Keep up-to-date at: https://t.co/uGQ4g6RGOV #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/G30aDbQXY6

tweets.text:
Heavy rain is expected in Yorkshire over the weekend. Our teams are working hard to check our flood defences. 

Pictured are flood defences they have strengthened in Todmorden #Calderdale. #PrepareActSurvive 
https://t.co/HNBU0rgQzk https://t.co/PYpv46pwBX

@EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgency There‚Äôs a huge build up of tree and branches from the floods 18 month ago under the old stone bridge in Rawtenstall near B&M. It‚Äôs a risk and higher river levels are showing it. Needs moving please.

Just brewing an ‚Å¶@KircabiRoasters‚Å© coffee as I‚Äôm about to pick up the ‚Å¶@EnvAgencyNW‚Å© Duty Manager for #Cumbria and #Lancashire from ‚Å¶@AndynBrown16‚Å© - operational teams deployed and others monitoring the rain and river and coastal levels in virtual incident room https://t.co/mE5XmkZx4m

tweets.text: A further flood warning has now been issued for the River Conder at Galgate. Motorists are being urged to avoid the area. https://t.co/2At1q1NNTr

Please take care as driving conditions maybe hazardous. 

Listen to traffic reports for advice & any disruptions locally.
https://t.co/uGQ4g6RGOV   

#PrepareActSurvive #StaySafe #Floods https://t.co/Gj8FpEX0Eh

tweets.text: The pitiful River Len in Kent is a contender for most abused river in the UK. Between a water treatment works close to its source and the narrow culvert pipe at its confluence with the R. Medway it is subjected to chronic modification, with multiple weirs, long culverts and dams. https://t.co/QRIKrrXHq9

Flood water can contain hidden dangers such as lifted manhole covers, sharp objects and chemicals. Don‚Äôt walk through flood water it‚Äôs not worth the risk.

Check your local flood risk at: https://t.co/uGQ4g6RGOV
#Floods #Flooding #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/7TlljJXHZc

tweets.text: @AndynBrown16 Any chance of an update if it looks imminent? Many Thanks.

@EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @thetimes "Our rivers and bathing waters are in a much better state than 20 years ago".

Does someone actually read this stuff?

Let me remind you, in 2016 14% of rivers in England reached 'Good' overall environmental health. 

In 2019? Err? None!

Time to go.

https://t.co/8J3kNikmZL
Lots of #floodalerts in place and @metoffice #weather warnings for #rain in place until tomorrow #beprepared #floodaware @EnvAgency https://t.co/cnHDBbMk7k

tweets.text:
#FloodAlert Weather warning from @EnvAgencyNW

 #Staveley #Ings #Burneside #Kendal #GarnettBridge #Stainton #Sedgwick #Holme #Beetham #Milnthorpe https://t.co/hxDq4i6Clt

Please keep up-to-date with the latest information in your area. 

See our latest #flood warnings (updated every 15 minutes): : https://t.co/uGQ4g6RGOV #Floods #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/wZde3bqDeP

Traveling this evening? Please do not drive through flood water. 

Check your route before you travel: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn 

Remember just one egg cup of water is enough to wreck your engine. #PrepareActSurvive #SafetyFirst https://t.co/uISw8pg6pm

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
In a #flood: gather essential items (like water, blankets, a torch, first aid kit, essential medication and food) and put them out of the way of flood water to keep dry. 

Check your flood risk: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn #PrepareActSurvive #SafetyFirst #floods https://t.co/OZhNbkaLiV

Did you know that #teamea can monitor river debris screens remotely from our incident rooms? Teams across the #northwest are keeping an eye on the regions rivers ahead of #StormDennis and will clear screens when needed throughout the weekend. #beprepared #DidYouKnow https://t.co/gt5t3Uy81b
This has absolutely got to stop @guardianeco . With supposed friends like @ForestryEngland @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland England's wildlife needs no enemies. https://t.co/TIQNLgYFkv

domain.name: Brand
domain.description: Brands and Companies

tweets.text:
Look at these beauties üòç

These were in our Blackwater eel trap after they left the Sargasso Sea and travelled 3,500km across the Atlantic to be here! #Eels #Essex https://t.co/lUoVpIDW0e

Flooding is possible across parts of northern England and the Midlands into Monday.

Check your #flood risk now: https://t.co/BpUpnjiX4L https://t.co/qJJ95PgYDL
@AndynBrown16 @EnvAgencyNW In a word 'grim'!... https://t.co/I5NwvaSQiH

Our @EnvAgency report on "3D buffer strips: designed to deliver more for the environment" has now been published https://t.co/OMSUPV0MSl. Considers how we can improve the effectiveness of buffer zones e.g. for #Waterquality #NaturalFloodManagement issues. #NatureBasedSolutions https://t.co/i88EInSAct

urls.title: Sign up for flood warnings
urls.description: Register your home or business in England, Scotland or Wales to receive flood warnings and find out how to check flood risk in Northern Ireland

tweets.text: We've been out today installing and checking temporary flood defences in advance of heavy rainfall tonight. These defences are near Riccall. If you don't receive our free flood warnings, sign up here: https://t.co/dj5PCHr2lX #PrepareActSurvive #floodaware https://t.co/jSJrXFDK63

Fisheries Enforcement Officers worked with Norfolk Constabulary Wildlife Crime Team to issue an Enforcement Notice to a fishery owner in Norfolk.

This action follows the discovery of two sturgeon - a non-native species that are not permitted to be held in any fishery. #Norfolk https://t.co/Hq9Hh0bLji

New @ForestryComm & @EnvAgency #Research & #Analysis on 3D-buffer strips 
https://t.co/9E4jYneVeQ
Good resource. Nothing particularly new. 
Q is - how do we ensure this info is in the hands of staff & contractors on the ground and gets put into practice? 
Via @Hydro_Mark @TM_WRT https://t.co/KFqU81rjiW
Sadly we have now had to also issue 2x more #flood warnings. 1 in #Ulverston & 1 in #Lancaster. Forecasts continue to be tricky so better to play safe. #floodaware https://t.co/gLPxtvyYMG

#TeamEA have been out in Ribchester and Billington in #Lancashire today. 

The riverüåämay look calm right now, but things can change quickly.

Make sure you're prepared and sign up now to receive flood alerts and warnings https://t.co/F1wbUHPZe8 https://t.co/KNNgiEuGMD

Do you know what to do if you receive a #flood warning? 

Find out what they mean and how to act if you receive one here: https://t.co/CFSTzxnzju  #Flooding #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/TU0WjxEtUy

The Environment Agency‚Äôs Chair, @EmmaHowardBoyd, has written to @thetimes in response to its reports on the agency‚Äôs approach to environmental regulation. 

Read more üëá

https://t.co/OzmPC32pRB

@Hyosube @eabroken2020 @EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @thetimes Badly organised. They have 11,000 employees. How many are field based delivering enforcement or environmental protection? A small percentage I'll wager.

"Rivers of Shame," today's @thetimes editorial.

Curious as to why @10DowningStreet are putting up with all of this. They must have realised by now that they've got a major liability on the hands and it's called the @EnvAgency. 

 https://t.co/SAVei8xunt
@GrittySpheres @jonhgurr @TimesRadio @alexisconran @DefraGovUK @Ofwat @EnvAgency @thameswater @WandleForum Here ya go. https://t.co/laGH5deEMS

Handover for oncoming shift completed. We‚Äôre now watching closely the rainfall over the next 72hrs. We will be ready to respond if we need to. Great job to all @EnvAgencyMids folk who‚Äôs been working the last few days and over the weekend, getting us into this position üëç #teamEA https://t.co/jJWnISE9Kf
